title: Cat. 113  Two Women Chattering
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section body" id="body">Two Women Chattering, headpiece for Le sourire (The Smile)  
1900  
Only state  
Wood-block print in black ink on thin ivory laid Japanese paper; 102 × 151 mm (image); 178 × 189 mm (sheet)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Edward McCormick Blair, 2002.252  
Guérin 81, Kornfeld 62 A

Two Women Chattering, headpiece for Le sourire (The Smile)  
1900  
Only state  
Wood-block print in black ink on thin ivory laid Japanese paper; 102 × 151mm (image); 151 × 229 mm (sheet)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, Clarence Buckingham Collection, 1951.38  
Guérin 81, Kornfeld 62 C

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">The catalogue raisonné erroneously listed this as 62 C, a posthumous impression, when in fact it should have been listed as 62 A, a trial proof. See Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 230, cat. 62.

The catalogue raisonné erroneously listed this as 62 C, a posthumous impression, when in fact it should have been listed as 62 A, a trial proof. See Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 230, cat. 62.

</section><section id="figures">Left, Two Women Chattering, headpiece for Le sourire (The Smile), 1900 (cat. 113.1). Right, Two Women Chattering, headpiece for Le sourire (The Smile), 1900 (cat. 113.2).

</section>
